p: tRNA halves are produced by cleavage of the anticodon loop giving rise to two halves; 30–35 nt 5′-tRNA halves and 40–50 nt 3′tRNA halves ( Li and Hu, 2012; Figure 1Eii). A subtype of tRNA halves known as tRNA-derived stress-induced RNAs (tiRNAs) are by-products of stress. They induce cleavage by angiogenin (ANG) – a ribonuclease – of mature cytoplasmic tRNAs ( Yamasaki et al., 2009).
